verses.text: \add This\add* then was the lot of the tribe of the children of Judah by their families; \add even\add* to the border of Edom, the wilderness of Zin southward \add was\add* the uttermost part of the south \add coast\add*.
And their south border was from the shore of the salt sea, from the bay that looketh southward:

and it went out to the south side to Maaleh-acrabbim, and passed along to Zin, and ascended up on the south side unto Kadesh-barnea, and passed along \add to\add* Hezron, and went up to Adar, and fetched a compass to Karkaa:
\add from thence\add* it passed toward Azmon, and went out \add unto\add* the river of Egypt; and the goings out of that coast were at the sea: this shall be your south coast.

And the east border \add was\add* the salt sea, \add even\add* unto the end of Jordan. And \add their\add* border in the north quarter \add was\add* from the bay of the sea at the uttermost part of Jordan:
and the border went up \add to\add* Beth-hogla, and passed along by the north of Beth-arabah; and the border went up \add to\add* the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben:

and the border went up toward Debir from the valley of Achor, and \add so\add* northward, looking toward Gilgal, that \add is\add* before the going up to Adummim, which \add is\add* on the south side of the river: and the border passed towards the waters of En-shemesh, and the goings out thereof were at En-rogel:

and the border went up \add by\add* the valley of the son of Hinnom unto the south side of the Jebusite; the same \add is\add* Jerusalem: and the border went up to the top of the mountain that \add lieth\add* before the valley of Hinnom westward, which \add is\add* at the end of the valley of the giants northward:

and the border was drawn from the top of the hill unto the fountain of the water of Nephtoah, and went out to the cities of mount Ephron; and the border was drawn \add to\add* Baalah, which \add is\add* Kirjath-jearim:

and the border compassed from Baalah westward unto mount Seir, and passed along unto the side of mount Jearim, which \add is\add* Chesalon, on the north side, and went down \add to\add* Beth-shemesh, and passed on \add to\add* Timnah:

and the border went out unto the side of Ekron northward: and the border was drawn to Shicron, and passed along \add to\add* mount Baalah, and went out \add unto\add* Jabneel; and the goings out of the border were at the sea.
And the west border \add was\add* to the great sea, and the coast \add thereof\add*. This \add is\add* the coast of the children of Judah round about according to their families.

And unto Caleb the son of Jephunneh he gave a part among the children of Judah, according to the commandment of the \sc Lord\sc* to Joshua, \add even\add* the city of Arba the father of Anak, which \add city is\add* Hebron.
And Caleb drove thence the three sons of Anak, Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.
And he went up thence to the inhabitants of Debir: and the name of Debir before \add was\add* Kirjath-sepher.
And Caleb said, He that smiteth Kirjath-sepher, and taketh it, to him will I give Achsah my daughter to wife.
And Othniel the son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.
And it came to pass, as she came \add unto him\add*, that she moved him to ask of her father a field: and she lighted off \add her\add* ass; and Caleb said unto her, What wouldest thou?
Who answered, Give me a blessing; for thou hast given me a south land; give me also springs of water. And he gave her the upper springs, and the nether springs.
This \add is\add* the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families.
And the uttermost cities of the tribe of the children of Judah toward the coast of Edom southward were Kabzeel, and Eder, and Jagur,
and Kinah, and Dimonah, and Adadah,
and Kedesh, and Hazor, and Ithnan,
Ziph, and Telem, and Bealoth,
and Hazor, Hadattah, and Kerioth, \add and\add* Hezron, which \add is\add* Hazor,
Amam, and Shema, and Moladah,
and Hazar-gaddah, and Heshmon, and Beth-palet,
and Hazar-shual, and Beersheba, and Bizjothjah,
Baalah, and Iim, and Azem,
and Eltolad, and Chesil, and Hormah,
and Ziklag, and Madmannah, and Sansannah,
and Lebaoth, and Shilhim, and Ain, and Rimmon: all the cities \add are\add* twenty and nine, with their villages.
\add And\add* in the valley, Eshtaol, and Zoreah, and Ashnah,
and Zanoah, and En-gannim, Tappuah, and Enam,
Jarmuth, and Adullam, Socoh, and Azekah,
and Sharaim, and Adithaim, and Gederah, and Gederothaim; fourteen cities with their villages.
Zenan, and Hadashah, and Migdal-gad,
and Dilean, and Mizpeh, and Joktheel,
Lachish, and Bozkath, and Eglon,
and Cabbon, and Lahmam, and Kithlish,
and Gederoth, Beth-dagon, and Naamah, and Makkedah; sixteen cities with their villages.
Libnah, and Ether, and Ashan,
and Jiphtah, and Ashnah, and Nezib,
and Keilah, and Achzib, and Mareshah; nine cities with their villages.
Ekron, with her towns and her villages:
from Ekron even unto the sea, all that \add lay\add* near Ashdod, with their villages:
Ashdod \add with\add* her towns and her villages, Gaza \add with\add* her towns and her villages, unto the river of Egypt, and the great sea, and the border \add thereof\add*.
And in the mountains, Shamir, and Jattir, and Socoh,
and Dannah, and Kirjath-sannah, which \add is\add* Debir,
and Anab, and Eshtemoh, and Anim,
and Goshen, and Holon, and Giloh; eleven cities with their villages.
Arab, and Dumah, and Eshean,
and Janum, and Beth-tappuah, and Aphekah,
and Humtah, and Kirjath-arba, which \add is\add* Hebron, and Zior; nine cities with their villages.
Maon, Carmel, and Ziph, and Juttah,
and Jezreel, and Jokdeam, and Zanoah,
Cain, Gibeah, and Timnah; ten cities with their villages.
Halhul, Beth-zur, and Gedor,
and Maarath, and Beth-anoth, and Eltekon; six cities with their villages.
Kirjath-baal, which \add is\add* Kirjath-jearim, and Rabbah; two cities with their villages.
In the wilderness, Beth-arabah, Middin, and Secacah,
and Nibshan, and the city of salt, and En-gedi; six cities with their villages.
As for the Jebusites the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the children of Judah could not drive them out: but the Jebusites dwell with the children of Judah at Jerusalem unto this day.
